body_html:
I apologize, I misunderstood, it seem you're looking for where these functions are at head, as opposed to the last release, right? The docs, FWIW, talk about the release and not the current state of the head of the repository.

Is it possible for you to use the latest release (0.12.1) for now (in which your original sample with tf.nn.rnn_cell.BasicLSTMCell and tf.nn.rnn should work)? Code at head is frequently changing and will provide a moving target. Once release, the compatibility tool at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/compatibility should help you switch between releases.

As of right now, is tf.contrib.rnn.static_rnn what you're looking for?

body:
I apologize, I misunderstood, it seem you're looking for where these functions are at head, as opposed to the last release, right? The docs, FWIW, talk about the release and not the current state of the head of the repository.

Is it possible for you to use the latest release (0.12.1) for now (in which your original sample with `tf.nn.rnn_cell.BasicLSTMCell` and `tf.nn.rnn` should work)? Code at head is frequently changing and will provide a moving target. Once release, the compatibility tool at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/compatibility should help you switch between releases.

As of right now, is `tf.contrib.rnn.static_rnn` what you're looking for?
